website_summaries.verdict: Minecraft: Story Mode is a family friendly romp through the Minecraft universe, but it lacks the narrative bite that Telltale Games is known for.
pros: The infrequent combat sections are enjoyable and interesting
cons: Story fails to create any tension or drama

customer_reviews.title: I was not aware that this wouldn't work on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I was not aware that this wouldn't work on my PC due to graphics card????? Any way to return it?
customer_reviews.author: Chance Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Cute but limited interaction on the player's part
customer_reviews.text: It's not as interactive as I'd have liked but it's really cute and the storyline varies with user inputs. It can be sad though (poor Ruben!!) I DID learn a few minecraft tricks from it though!
customer_reviews.author: Gary AZ

customer_reviews.title: My first review ever but I am very disappointed, in that I purchased two of these for ...
customer_reviews.text: My first review ever but I am very disappointed, in that I purchased two of these for two different users and computers and neither will work! The game is not usable with a computer that doesn't have certain video cards. It should have been clearly listed in the description that it needed a certain video card.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fore

customer_reviews.title: Good Game, Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good game based off of Minecraft. You definitely don't have to be a hardcore Minecrafter to play it, but it is recommended, obviously. Like every other game, it tends to lag depending on how many other programs you have open, but performance is good when you don't have other things running. Overall, a really fun-to-play and user-friendly game. I really love that the characters think of you differently based on what you do/say to them, but that's just Telltale Games doing a great job once again.
customer_reviews.author: cool

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but a quick play-thru
customer_reviews.text: My teen daughter was really excited to get this. It came with 4 episodes, I think they will release another one soon? Hopefully! Anyway, she really liked it..my only complaint is, it played pretty quickly...she finished all 4 episodes in just a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Ang S.

customer_reviews.title: Is alright.
customer_reviews.text: Meh.. it's ok. Not really anything like what I was expecting. But it's Minecraft so still fun. :)
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Davis

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: not what my grand daughter thought it was and did not play correctly on computer
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: and I've honestly had a pretty good time with it as well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my Minecraft-crazy oldest daughter. She enjoys it, and I've honestly had a pretty good time with it as well.

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy Download
customer_reviews.text: Real easy. Download, go to manufacturer site, enter code, your up and running. My kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Johnson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: after 3 days i could not open the game .
customer_reviews.author: annette

customer_reviews.title: Fun times and fun games
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game and it was a no-brainer when we saw it available. Fun game and fun times with my son!
customer_reviews.author: A. Goswick

customer_reviews.title: A riveting story. Decision making aspect keeps you on your toes!
customer_reviews.text: All three of my kids (15, 12, 10) love this game. The decision making and story are great aspects that provide hours of gameplay. I'd say there's well over 10 hours of play time for all 5 episodes.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Great if you need a gift for a Minecraft fan
customer_reviews.text: My son is enjoying this. Great if you need a gift for a Minecraft fan.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Does not include all episodes
customer_reviews.text: This game does NOT, I repeat does NOT include ALL of the episodes! I bought the gaming and it was listed as "season pass." but for episodes 6 and on you have to pay an extra $15 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: 100% RIPPED ME OFF
customer_reviews.text: Paid for this download and received a download code. When I follow the steps to download the game on the telltalegames site, I get error message stating code is unknown. 100% RIP-OFF.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: I didn't have any issues the code or the download and install like other users did
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Minecraft: Story Mode - A Telltale Games Series [Online Game Code] for my 11 year old son. I didn't have any issues the code or the download and install like other users did. While he liked the game very much he flew through all of the stories within a week and hasn't touched it since. . According to him he finished the stories, I don't play so I can't confirm if he actually did everything there was to do or he just lost interest. He does say he is looking forward to the new story coming out.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: No problems with the code, or download. However ...
customer_reviews.text: No problems with the code, or download. However I would have preferred to get a steam code rather than have to deal with another platform for games.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Says it's MAC compatible. Not so much....
customer_reviews.text: Crashed, and keeps crashing, our computer. Paid $13 for something I can't use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would probably be great, but our internet connection is so slow that ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 9 year old. Would probably be great, but our internet connection is so slow that he cannot play it do to lag. Works great on the phone but gets boring after a bit because you have to pay $5 for each additional episode. If you found this review helpful in any way please take a moment and hit the button. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree

customer_reviews.title: Guess I wasted $20.00
customer_reviews.text: Not able to download to my kids computer......came to my Amazon account. Thought there was more than one download. Can't use code to put on her computer contacted them and have heard nothing.
customer_reviews.author: James Bond 009.5

customer_reviews.title: you click once every 5 mins to get your character to do something otherwise it is like watching a comic like movie and like i sa
customer_reviews.text: For one this is available free on Droid. Two I already had it and was looking for the actual game NOT just story mode which has almost ZERO gameplay at all. you click once every 5 mins to get your character to do something otherwise it is like watching a comic like movie and like i said, minimal interaction. Looking to get money back as I have done Nothing with this since I accessed as i realized late that i already had it on my phone FREE!

customer_reviews.title: It was a total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We were never able to put it on our computer. It was a total waste of money. When we uploaded it to our Mac it changed the configuration of our desktop.

product_meta.title: Minecraft: Story Mode – A Telltale Games Series [Online Game Code]
product_meta.description:
THE ADVENTURE OF A LIFETIME IN THE WORLD OF MINECRAFT

In this five part episodic series, play as either a male or female hero named 'Jesse,' and embark on a perilous adventure across the Overworld, through the Nether, to the End, and beyond. You and your friends revere the legendary Order of the Stone: Warrior, Redstone Engineer, Griefer, and Architect; slayers of the Ender Dragon. While at EnderCon in hopes of meeting Gabriel the Warrior, you and your friends discover that something is wrong… something dreadful. Terror is unleashed, and you must set out on a quest to find The Order of the Stone if you are to save your world from oblivion.

 * Created by award-winning adventure game powerhouse Telltale Games, in partnership with Minecraft creators, Mojang
 * Featuring the voices of Patton Oswalt (Ratatouille, Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D), Brian Posehn (The Sarah Silverman Program, Mission Hill), Ashley Johnson (The Last of Us, Tales from the Borderlands), Scott Porter (Friday Night Lights, X-Men), Martha Plimpton (The Goonies, Raising Hope), Dave Fennoy (The Walking Dead: A Telltale Games Series, Batman: Arkham Knight), Corey Feldman (The Goonies, Stand by Me), Billy West (Futurama, Adventure Time), and Paul Reubens (Tron: Uprising, Pee-Wee’s Playhouse)
 * You will drive the story through the decisions you make: what you say to people (and how you say it), and what you choose to do in moments of thrilling action will make this YOUR story

PC Requirements

Minimum System Requirements:  * Supported OS:XP Service Pack 3 
 * Processor: Core 2 Duo 2GHz or equivalent
 * RAM: 3 GB
 * Hard Disk: 8 GB
 * Video Card: ATI or NVidia card w/ 512 MB RAM (Not recommended for Intel integrated graphics)
 * DirectX: Direct X 9.0c 
 * Sound: Direct X 9.0c sound device

Recommended System Requirements:  * Processor: Core 2 Duo 2.3 Ghz or equivalent
 * RAM: 4 GB
 * Video Card: ATI or NVidia card w/ 1024 MB RAM 

Mac Requirements

Minimum System Requirements:  * Supported OS:Lion (10.7.X)
 * Processor: 2.3 Ghz Intel
 * RAM: 4 GB
 * Hard Disk: 8 GB
 * Video Card: 512 MB Nvidia or ATI graphics card
 * Additional Requirements: Not recommended for Intel integrated graphics or Mac Minis or early-generation MacBooks


Telltale account required for game activation and installation.
